description.en: MaidSafeCoin serves as a token for Safecoin, a decentralized currency for a decentralized network. Safecoin will serve as the currency for the SAFE network, a network made up of the extra hard disk space, processing power, and data connectivity of its users. Think of it as the sharing economy but for your digital resources. MaidSafe is the company developing the SAFE network to save the world from the perils of centralized data storage. In the current paradigm, the best case is corporations use your data to better target you to their advertisers. The worst case is they leak your private data to the public, as Yahoo, Equifax, Target, and many other companies have already done. The SAFE network ultimately wants to “create a secure, autonomous, data-centric, peer-to-peer network as an alternative to the current server-centric model.” There will be two main users of the network: clients and farmers. The client accesses the various features of the network, such as browsing, storing data, or transferring money. The farmers store and look after your data until it’s needed, at which point they might receive a reward for their efforts. The SAFE network is an “encrypted layer that sits on top of the current internet, allowing for autonomous data storage and networking by replacing three” of the OSI networking layers. MaidSafe, a Scotland based company, started developing the SAFE network in 2006. The presale on April 22nd, 2014 sold 10% of all MaidSafeCoins. You could buy 17,000 MaidSafeCoins for 1 BTC at that time. The company allowed 30 days to try and reach their 8 million dollar fundraising goal, but they reached the target in just 5 hours. The team is currently in stage Alpha 2 on their roadmap. the future of this crypto, quite like other presently available cryptos such as BitShares, Cardano, Dent, looks bright because the concept of having a decentralized internet is a fresh one. As more and more networks—whether data networks or social media—make the shift to decentralization, MaidSafeCoin coins’ value will grow. Just keep an eye on MAID because it is all set to seriously disrupt the internet landscape for the better. The future of this crypto, quite like other presently available cryptos such as BitShares, Cardano, Dent, looks bright because the concept of having a decentralized internet is a fresh one. As more and more networks—whether data networks or social media—make the shift to decentralization, MaidSafeCoin coins’ value will grow. Just keep an eye on MAID because it is all set to seriously disrupt the internet landscape for the better."

The team is currently in stage Alpha 2 on their roadmap. the future of this crypto, quite like other presently available cryptos such as BitShares, Cardano, Dent, looks bright because the concept of having a decentralized internet is a fresh one. As more and more networks—whether data networks or social media—make the shift to decentralization, MaidSafeCoin coins’ value will grow. Just keep an eye on MAID because it is all set to seriously disrupt the internet landscape for the better. The future of this crypto, quite like other presently available cryptos such as BitShares, Cardano, Dent, looks bright because the concept of having a decentralized internet is a fresh one. As more and more networks—whether data networks or social media—make the shift to decentralization, MaidSafeCoin coins’ value will grow. Just keep an eye on MAID because it is all set to seriously disrupt the internet landscape for the better."
description.ar: MaidSafeCoin serves as a token for Safecoin, a decentralized currency for a decentralized network. Safecoin will serve as the currency for the SAFE network, a network made up of the extra hard disk space, processing power, and data connectivity of its users. Think of it as the sharing economy but for your digital resources. MaidSafe is the company developing the SAFE network to save the world from the perils of centralized data storage. In the current paradigm, the best case is corporations use your data to better target you to their advertisers. The worst case is they leak your private data to the public, as Yahoo, Equifax, Target, and many other companies have already done. The SAFE network ultimately wants to “create a secure, autonomous, data-centric, peer-to-peer network as an alternative to the current server-centric model.” There will be two main users of the network: clients and farmers. The client accesses the various features of the network, such as browsing, storing data, or transferring money. The farmers store and look after your data until it’s needed, at which point they might receive a reward for their efforts. The SAFE network is an “encrypted layer that sits on top of the current internet, allowing for autonomous data storage and networking by replacing three” of the OSI networking layers. MaidSafe, a Scotland based company, started developing the SAFE network in 2006. The presale on April 22nd, 2014 sold 10% of all MaidSafeCoins. You could buy 17,000 MaidSafeCoins for 1 BTC at that time. The company allowed 30 days to try and reach their 8 million dollar fundraising goal, but they reached the target in just 5 hours. The team is currently in stage Alpha 2 on their roadmap. the future of this crypto, quite like other presently available cryptos such as BitShares, Cardano, Dent, looks bright because the concept of having a decentralized internet is a fresh one. As more and more networks—whether data networks or social media—make the shift to decentralization, MaidSafeCoin coins’ value will grow. Just keep an eye on MAID because it is all set to seriously disrupt the internet landscape for the better. The future of this crypto, quite like other presently available cryptos such as BitShares, Cardano, Dent, looks bright because the concept of having a decentralized internet is a fresh one. As more and more networks—whether data networks or social media—make the shift to decentralization, MaidSafeCoin coins’ value will grow. Just keep an eye on MAID because it is all set to seriously disrupt the internet landscape for the better."

Safecoin will serve as the currency for the SAFE network, a network made up of the extra hard disk space, processing power, and data connectivity of its users. Think of it as the sharing economy but for your digital resources. MaidSafe is the company developing the SAFE network to save the world from the perils of centralized data storage. In the current paradigm, the best case is corporations use your data to better target you to their advertisers. The worst case is they leak your private data to the public, as Yahoo, Equifax, Target, and many other companies have already done. The SAFE network ultimately wants to “create a secure, autonomous, data-centric, peer-to-peer network as an alternative to the current server-centric model.” There will be two main users of the network: clients and farmers. The client accesses the various features of the network, such as browsing, storing data, or transferring money. The farmers store and look after your data until it’s needed, at which point they might receive a reward for their efforts. The SAFE network is an “encrypted layer that sits on top of the current internet, allowing for autonomous data storage and networking by replacing three” of the OSI networking layers. MaidSafe, a Scotland based company, started developing the SAFE network in 2006. The presale on April 22nd, 2014 sold 10% of all MaidSafeCoins. You could buy 17,000 MaidSafeCoins for 1 BTC at that time. The company allowed 30 days to try and reach their 8 million dollar fundraising goal, but they reached the target in just 5 hours. The team is currently in stage Alpha 2 on their roadmap. the future of this crypto, quite like other presently available cryptos such as BitShares, Cardano, Dent, looks bright because the concept of having a decentralized internet is a fresh one. As more and more networks—whether data networks or social media—make the shift to decentralization, MaidSafeCoin coins’ value will grow. Just keep an eye on MAID because it is all set to seriously disrupt the internet landscape for the better. The future of this crypto, quite like other presently available cryptos such as BitShares, Cardano, Dent, looks bright because the concept of having a decentralized internet is a fresh one. As more and more networks—whether data networks or social media—make the shift to decentralization, MaidSafeCoin coins’ value will grow. Just keep an eye on MAID because it is all set to seriously disrupt the internet landscape for the better."

ico_data.short_desc: SAFE (Secure Access For Everyone) Network based on the unused hard drive, processing power and data connection of the users.

status_updates.description:
Oh No! Poloniex Delisted MaidSafeCoin (MAID). Fear Not! Here’s What to Do Next
https://medium.com/safenetwork/oh-no-poloniex-delists-maidsafecoin-maid-fear-not-heres-what-to-do-next-4d9304ce3cbb

SAFE Network Dev Update 11th October: This week, we released the first version of the SAFE Network App.  In the world of Node Ageing, we’re quickly tearing through the tasks in parallel with a pretty major clean up of code and functions that aren’t required.  And, we implemented a dog command in the SAFE CLI as a companion to our lonely cat command.   Check out the full update here:  https://safenetforum.org/t/safe-network-dev-update-october-10-2019/30063/1

SAFE Network Dev 3rd October: This week saw the release of an updated SAFE Browser that will enable it to use the provided mimetype for the new XOR-URLs plus a new post on the Perpetual Web browser, whilst Vaults Phase 2 moved ever closer to completion. For more details together with how we've simplified the bootstrapping process in Routing whilst progressing the SAFE CLI, SNAPP (SAFE Network App) and Node Ageing >> https://safenetforum.org/t/safe-network-dev-update-october-3-2019/29992

SAFE Network Dev Update 27th September: We released a new version of the SAFE Browser bringing some really cool features of the Perpetual Web to life. Vaults Phase 2 work continues to steam on and in the SAFE CLI repo, a lot of work has been carried out on getting the first set of Foreign Function Interface functions for the SAFE APIs ready.  And work on implementing Node Ageing has started. https://safenetforum.org/t/safe-network-dev-update-september-26-2019/29961

SAFE Network Dev Update 20th September: SAFE CLI v0.4.0 is now ready, which incorporates a couple of minor fixes and two additional features. Work is progressing grandly on all fronts, with releases imminent on the POC browser and SNAPP.  A podcast discussing the Phase 1 Vaults and data types is now ready, as are some video tutorials to help you on your way with said Vaults and the new CLIs. https://safenetforum.org/t/safe-network-dev-update-september-19-2019/29908

SAFE Network Dev Update 13th September:  This week, we have an overview of Phase 2 Vaults, an update on BLS and SMD in Routing and some PRs merged across the SAFE Mobile Browser and SNAPP.  There is also some new content, digging deeper into the data types and a look under the hood at the new CLIs.  Check it out now! https://safenetforum.org/t/safe-network-dev-update-september-12-2019/29840/15

SAFE Network Dev Update 5th September: There’s a handful of releases this week including SAFE Mobile Brower v0.2 (including an update to the SAFE Mobile Authenticator) latest binaries for SAFE Authenticator CLI and SAFE CLI.  After the Vaults release last week, we’ve updated POC browser for Mac and Linux.  And there is new content on Medium to check out.  So what are you waiting for?  Read all about it over on the forum: https://safenetforum.org/t/safe-network-dev-update-september-5-2019/29770
